(Simplified: 觅)
Ideographic: To search for something with eyes 見 and hands 爫
purpleculture_examples:
覓食 [ mì shí ]: to forage; to hunt for food; to scavenge; fig. to make a living
覓取 [ mì qǔ ]: to seek; to seek out

    • 見 [ jiàn ] to see, to observe, to meet, to appear
heisig_chinese_memo: As a survival technique, if you see a vulture you can try to find the kill that might be close by.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you claw (爫) what you see (見) as you seek
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Anytime you see a vulture, it's on the same mission - try to find food.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from " seeing " from " claw ", the form of seeing with the hand half covering the eyes, the original meaning is peeping, and the extension expresses seeking. Guo Yanruo thinks it is the first article of "覛", "Jiyun": "覛, "Shuowen" is regarded. Or is for search."

Jin Wen said to seek, and Ban Gui said: "Ban Fei dared to find," which means that Ban dared not ask for something. "Yu Pian": "Look, seek." "Guang Yun": "Look, seek also." Also pronounced " free ", which means exemption, and Ding: "Zhang Mi (free) Kuang Si Zi." means 曶Exemption of compensation from Kuang 30 Zihe.
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from " seeing " from " claws ", the form of seeing with one hand half covering the eyes, the original meaning is peeping, and the extension means seeking.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「見」從「爪」，會以手半遮眼睛而視之形，本義是窺視，引申表示尋求。郭沬若認為是「覛」的初文，《集韻》：「覛，《說文》衺視。或作覓。」

　　金文表示求索，班簋：「班非敢覓」，表示班不敢有所求。《玉篇》：「覓，索也。」《廣韻》：「覓，求也。」又讀作「免」，表示免除，曶鼎：「曶覓(免)匡卅秭。」表示曶免除匡三十秭禾的賠償。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「見」從「爪」，會以手半遮眼睛而視之形，本義是窺視，引申表示尋求。

①找，尋求：覓食。覓取。尋覓。搜覓。
②數量單位，中國唐代南詔以十六枚貝爲一覓。

HSK: 6

Kanshudo mnemonic:you claw (爫) what you see (見) as you seek
Chinese: As a survival technique, if you see a vulture you can try to find the kill that might be close by.
Meaning: try to find
Hanzi: 觅
Story: Anytime you see a vulture, it's on the same mission - try to find food.
Kind: traditional

金文從「 見 」從「 爪 」，會以手半遮眼睛而視之形，本義是窺視，引申表示尋求。郭沬若認為是「 覛 」的初文，《集韻》：「覛，《說文》衺視。或作覓。」 金文表示求索，班簋：「班非敢覓」，表示班不敢有所求。《玉篇》：「覓，索也。」《廣韻》：「覓，求也。」又讀作「 免 」，表示免除，曶鼎：「曶覓(免)匡卅秭。」表示曶免除匡三十秭禾的賠償。
Bronze inscription from " seeing" from " claw", the form of seeing with the hand half covering the eyes, the original meaning is peeping, and the extension expresses seeking. Guo Yanruo thinks it is the first article of " 覛", "Jiyun": "覛, "Shuowen" is regarded. Or is for search." Jin Wen said to seek, and Ban Gui said: "Ban Fei dared to find," which means that Ban dared not ask for something. "Yu Pian": "Look, seek." "Guang Yun": "Look, seek also." Also pronounced " free", which means exemption, and Ding: "Zhang Mi (free) Kuang Si Zi." means 曶Exemption of compensation from Kuang 30 Zihe.

覓字的基本解释

覓
mì
见“觅”。

覓字的汉语字典释义

[①]［mì］
［《廣韻》莫狄切，入錫，明。］
“觅1”的繁体字。亦作“覔1”。亦作“1”。
(1)寻找。
(2)求取。
(3)指窃取。
(4)唐时南诏境内交易时的一种比价。以贝十六枚为一觅，相当于缯帛四尺五寸。

覓字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【見字部】　覓； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页1134第03
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?莫狄切，銘入聲。【廣韻】求也。【魏志·管輅傳】覓索餘光。【晉書·武帝紀】是猶欲登山者，涉舟航而覓路。　又【唐書·南蠻傳】南詔以貝十六枚爲一覓。　又【宋史·眞宗紀】祥符三年，以西凉府覓諾族瘴疫，賜藥。　【正字通】从爪从見。俗作覔。非。【字彙補】一作??。【集韻】本作覛，亦書作?，或作眽，?非。

覓字的源字形

字源演变：

金文楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
覓字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［mì］
["Guangyun" Modiqie, enter the tin, and Ming. ]
The traditional characters of "找1". Also known as "覔1". Also known as "1".
(1) Search.
(2) Obtain.
(3) Refers to stealing.
(4) A price comparison in Nanzhao's domestic transactions in the Tang Dynasty. Taking sixteen shells as a search is equivalent to four feet and five inches in length.
